title: Minimal Land Vulnerability to Sea Level Rise
description: In 2015, only 0.004% of Jordan's total land area was below 5 meters in elevation, indicating minimal vulnerability to sea level rise.

title: Efficient Electrical Connection Process
description: As of 2019, it took just 3.8 days to obtain an electrical connection in Jordan, showcasing an efficient infrastructure process.

title: High Child Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2016, 40.93% of economically active male children aged 7-14 were employed in agriculture, highlighting a significant reliance on child labor in this sector.

title: Predominance of Unpaid Family Work Among Female Children
description: A staggering 97.3% of female children in employment aged 7-14 were unpaid family workers in 2016, indicating a lack of formal employment opportunities.

title: High Unemployment Among Educated Males
description: In 2023, 20.645% of the male labor force with advanced education was unemployed, reflecting challenges in the job market for educated individuals.

title: Significant Child Labor in Manufacturing
description: In 2016, 17.53% of economically active male children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, indicating a notable presence of child labor in this industry.

title: Minimal Female Child Employment
description: Only 0.4% of female children aged 7-14 were in employment in 2016, suggesting low levels of child labor among females.

title: High Rate of Study and Work Among Female Children
description: In 2016, 97.97% of female children in employment aged 7-14 were involved in both study and work, indicating a dual burden on young girls.

title: Excessive Working Hours for Male Children
description: Male children aged 7-14 worked an average of 50.53 hours per week in 2016, highlighting excessive working conditions.

title: Low Overall Child Employment
description: In 2016, only 1.23% of children aged 7-14 were in employment, reflecting a relatively low rate of child labor.
